segment.source: This article describes how to send a local tile notification to a primary tile and a secondary tile using adaptive tile templates.
segment.target: This article describes how to send a local tile notification to a primary tile and a secondary tile using adaptive tile templates.

segment.source: Send a local tile notification
segment.target: Send a local tile notification

segment.source: Send a local tile notification
segment.target: Send a local tile notification

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Primary app tiles in Windows 10 are defined in your app manifest, while secondary tiles are programmatically created and defined by your app code.
segment.target: Primary app tiles in Windows 10 are defined in your app manifest, while secondary tiles are programmatically created and defined by your app code.

segment.source: This article describes how to send a local tile notification to a primary tile and a secondary tile using adaptive tile templates.
segment.target: This article describes how to send a local tile notification to a primary tile and a secondary tile using adaptive tile templates.

segment.source: (A local notification is one that's sent from app code as opposed to one that's pushed or pulled from a web server.)
segment.target: (A local notification is one that's sent from app code as opposed to one that's pushed or pulled from a web server.)

segment.source: default tile and tile with notification
segment.target: default tile and tile with notification

segment.source: Note Learn about creating adaptive tiles and adaptive tile template schema.
segment.target: Note Learn about creating adaptive tiles and adaptive tile template schema.

segment.source: Install the NuGet package
segment.target: Install the NuGet package

segment.source: We recommend installing the NotificationsExtensions NuGet package, which simplifies things by generating tile payloads with objects instead of raw XML.
segment.target: We recommend installing the NotificationsExtensions NuGet package, which simplifies things by generating tile payloads with objects instead of raw XML.

segment.source: The inline code examples in this article are for C# with the NotificationsExtensions NuGet package installed.
segment.target: The inline code examples in this article are for C# with the NotificationsExtensions NuGet package installed.

segment.source: (If you'd prefer to create your own XML, you can find code examples without NotificationsExtensions toward the end of the article.)
segment.target: (If you'd prefer to create your own XML, you can find code examples without NotificationsExtensions toward the end of the article.)

segment.source: Add namespace declarations
segment.target: Add namespace declarations

segment.source: To access the tile APIs, include the Windows.UI.Notifications namespace.
segment.target: To access the tile APIs, include the Windows.UI.Notifications namespace.

segment.source: We also recommend including the NotificationsExtensions.Tiles namespace so that you can take advantage of our tile helper APIs (you must install the NotificationsExtensions NuGet package to access these APIs).
segment.target: We also recommend including the NotificationsExtensions.Tiles namespace so that you can take advantage of our tile helper APIs (you must install the NotificationsExtensions NuGet package to access these APIs).

segment.source: Create the notification content
segment.target: Create the notification content

segment.source: In Windows 10, tile payloads are defined using adaptive tile templates, which allow you to create custom visual layouts for your notifications.
segment.target: In Windows 10, tile payloads are defined using adaptive tile templates, which allow you to create custom visual layouts for your notifications.

segment.source: (To learn what's possible with adaptive tiles, see the Create adaptive tiles and Adaptive tile templates articles.)
segment.target: (To learn what's possible with adaptive tiles, see the Create adaptive tiles and Adaptive tile templates articles.)

segment.source: This code example creates adaptive tile content for medium and wide tiles.
segment.target: This code example creates adaptive tile content for medium and wide tiles.

segment.source: The notification content looks like the following when displayed on a medium tile:
segment.target: The notification content looks like the following when displayed on a medium tile:

segment.source: notification content on a medium tile
segment.target: notification content on a medium tile

segment.source: Create the notification
segment.target: Create the notification

segment.source: Once you have your notification content, you'll need to create a new TileNotification.
segment.target: Once you have your notification content, you'll need to create a new TileNotification.

segment.source: The TileNotification constructor takes a Windows Runtime XmlDocument object, which you can obtain from the TileContent.GetXml method if you're using NotificationsExtensions.
segment.target: The TileNotification constructor takes a Windows Runtime XmlDocument object, which you can obtain from the TileContent.GetXml method if you're using NotificationsExtensions.

segment.source: This code example creates a notification for a new tile.
segment.target: This code example creates a notification for a new tile.

segment.source: Set an expiration time for the notification (optional)
segment.target: Set an expiration time for the notification (optional)

segment.source: By default, local tile and badge notifications don't expire, while push, periodic, and scheduled notifications expire after three days.
segment.target: By default, local tile and badge notifications don't expire, while push, periodic, and scheduled notifications expire after three days.

segment.source: Because tile content shouldn't persist longer than necessary, it's a best practice to set an expiration time that makes sense for your app, especially on local tile and badge notifications.
segment.target: Because tile content shouldn't persist longer than necessary, it's a best practice to set an expiration time that makes sense for your app, especially on local tile and badge notifications.

segment.source: This code example creates a notification that expires and will be removed from the tile after ten minutes.
segment.target: This code example creates a notification that expires and will be removed from the tile after ten minutes.

segment.source: Send the notification
segment.target: Send the notification

segment.source: Although locally sending a tile notification is simple, sending the notification to a primary or secondary tile is a bit different.
segment.target: Although locally sending a tile notification is simple, sending the notification to a primary or secondary tile is a bit different.

segment.source: Primary tile
segment.target: Primary tile

segment.source: To send a notification to a primary tile, use the TileUpdateManager to create a tile updater for the primary tile, and send the notification by calling "Update".
segment.target: To send a notification to a primary tile, use the TileUpdateManager to create a tile updater for the primary tile, and send the notification by calling "Update".

segment.source: Regardless of whether it's visible, your app's primary tile always exists, so you can send notifications to it even when it's not pinned.
segment.target: Regardless of whether it's visible, your app's primary tile always exists, so you can send notifications to it even when it's not pinned.

segment.source: If the user pins your primary tile later, the notifications that you sent will appear then.
segment.target: If the user pins your primary tile later, the notifications that you sent will appear then.

segment.source: This code example sends a notification to a primary tile.
segment.target: This code example sends a notification to a primary tile.

segment.source: Secondary tile
segment.target: Secondary tile

segment.source: To send a notification to a secondary tile, first make sure that the secondary tile exists.
segment.target: To send a notification to a secondary tile, first make sure that the secondary tile exists.

segment.source: If you try to create a tile updater for a secondary tile that doesn't exist (for example, if the user unpinned the secondary tile), an exception will be thrown.
segment.target: If you try to create a tile updater for a secondary tile that doesn't exist (for example, if the user unpinned the secondary tile), an exception will be thrown.

segment.source: You can use SecondaryTile.Exists(tileId) to discover if your secondary tile is pinned, and then create a tile updater for the secondary tile and send the notification.
segment.target: You can use SecondaryTile.Exists(tileId) to discover if your secondary tile is pinned, and then create a tile updater for the secondary tile and send the notification.

segment.source: This code example sends a notification to a secondary tile.
segment.target: This code example sends a notification to a secondary tile.

segment.source: default tile and tile with notification
segment.target: default tile and tile with notification

segment.source: Clear notifications on the tile (optional)
segment.target: Clear notifications on the tile (optional)

segment.source: In most cases, you should clear a notification once the user has interacted with that content.
segment.target: In most cases, you should clear a notification once the user has interacted with that content.

segment.source: For example, when the user launches your app, you might want to clear all the notifications from the tile.
segment.target: For example, when the user launches your app, you might want to clear all the notifications from the tile.

segment.source: If your notifications are time-bound, we recommend that you set an expiration time on the notification instead of explicitly clearing the notification.
segment.target: If your notifications are time-bound, we recommend that you set an expiration time on the notification instead of explicitly clearing the notification.

segment.source: This code example clears the tile notification.
segment.target: This code example clears the tile notification.

segment.source: For a tile with the notification queue enabled and notifications in the queue, calling the Clear method empties the queue.
segment.target: For a tile with the notification queue enabled and notifications in the queue, calling the Clear method empties the queue.

segment.source: You can't, however, clear a notification via your app's server; only the local app code can clear notifications.
segment.target: You can't, however, clear a notification via your app's server; only the local app code can clear notifications.

segment.source: Periodic or push notifications can only add new notifications or replace existing notifications.
segment.target: Periodic or push notifications can only add new notifications or replace existing notifications.

segment.source: A local call to the Clear method will clear the tile whether or not the notifications themselves came via push, periodic, or local.
segment.target: A local call to the Clear method will clear the tile whether or not the notifications themselves came via push, periodic, or local.

segment.source: Scheduled notifications that haven't yet appeared are not cleared by this method.
segment.target: Scheduled notifications that haven't yet appeared are not cleared by this method.

segment.source: tile with notification and tile after being cleared
segment.target: tile with notification and tile after being cleared

segment.target: Using the notification queue

segment.source: Now that you have done your first tile update, you can expand the functionality of the tile by enabling a notification queue.
segment.target: Now that you have done your first tile update, you can expand the functionality of the tile by enabling a notification queue.

segment.target: This article shows you how to send the tile update as a notification.

segment.target: To explore other methods of notification delivery, including scheduled, periodic, and push, see Delivering notifications.
